Public Function CrossValidateNonCalibrated (data As IDataView, estimator As IEstimator(Of ITransformer), Optional numFolds As Integer = 5, Optional labelColumn As String = "Label", Optional stratificationColumn As String = null, Optional seed As Nullable(Of UInteger) = null) As ValueTuple(Of BinaryClassificationMetrics, ITransformer, IDataView)()

member this.CrossValidateNonCalibrated : Microsoft.Data.DataView.IDataView * Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer> * int * string * string * Nullable<uint32> -> ValueTuple<Microsoft.ML.Data.BinaryClassificationMetrics, Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer, Microsoft.Data.DataView.IDataView>[]

Docs.param: The data to run cross-validation on.
The estimator to fit.
Number of cross-validation folds.
The label column (for evaluation).

Optional name of the column to use as a stratification column. If two examples share the same value of the (if provided), they are guaranteed to appear in the same subset (train or test). Use this to make sure there is no label leakage from train to the test set. If this optional parameter is not provided, a stratification columns will be generated, and its values will be random numbers .

Optional parameter used in combination with the . If the is not provided, the random numbers generated to create it, will use this seed as value. And if it is not provided, the default value will be used.
Docs.summary: Run cross-validation over folds of , by fitting , and respecting if provided. Then evaluate each sub-model against and return metrics.
Docs.returns: Per-fold results: metrics, models, scored datasets.
